com.github.mlefeb01.spigotutils.api.object

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mlefeb01.spigotutils.api.object.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Schedule object that wraps a Deque of HourMinute objects in the order they will occur relative to the current time. Provides functionality to find the next HourMinute in the schedule in HourMinute form or as an epoch timestamp (seconds)

    Upon creation of a Schedule, an O(n) preprocess occurs where the given collection of HourMinute is streamed and sorted into a LinkedList in ascending order from 00:00 to 23:59. Then, findNext is called to sort the schedule once again but now relative to the current time. It will detach the head and append it to the deque until the head of the deque is the next HourMinute that will occur relative to when the sort occurs. This O(n) preprocess is necessary because it allows us to achieve O(1) findNext() calls after the preprocess. The deque of hourMinutes needs to be sorted to achieve that constant findNext() runtime, because after the initialization updates generally just detach the head and append it to the deque.

    • Method Detail

      • findNext

        public void findNext()
        Finds the next HourMinute in the schedule

      • getNext

        public HourMinute getNext()
        Getter for the next HourMinute in the schedule. Null if the schedule is empty
        Returns:
        HourMinute of next time

      • getNextEpoch

        public long getNextEpoch()
        Getter for the epoch timestamp (in seconds) of the next time in the schedule. 0 if the schedule is empty
        Returns:
        epoch time in seconds

      • setLastEvent

        public void setLastEvent()
        Sets the last occurrence of the schedule to the next HourMinute in the schedule. This method should only be called after isNextEventTime()

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the schedule, this should be called after isNextEventTime() returns true. This method will set the lastEvent reference and update the next event in the schedule

      • isNextEventTime

        public boolean isNextEventTime()
        Determines if the current time is the same time as the next HourMinute in the schedule
        Returns:
        boolean if the time is the next event time

      • getSecondsUntilNext

        public int getSecondsUntilNext()
        Returns the number of seconds until the next time in the schedule
        Returns:
        int seconds

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns if the schedule is empty
        Returns:
        empty
